data.enText: one of the small lines of thread that you can see on a piece of cloth after it has been sewn; the action that produces this

data.chText: 针脚要尽量缝得小而直。
data.enText: Try to keep the stitches small and straight.
one of the small circles of wool that you make around the needle when you are knitting
to drop a stitch (= to lose one that you have made)
a particular style of sewing or knitting that you use to make the pattern you want
chain stitch
a short piece of thread, etc. that doctors use to sew the edges of a wound together
The cut needed eight stitches.

data.chText: 肋部突然的疼痛（多由奔跑或笑引起）；岔气
data.enText: a sudden pain in the side of your body, usually caused by running or laughing

data.chText: 我们慢一点好不好？我岔气了。
data.enText: Can we slow down? I've got a stitch.
in stitches
laughing a lot

data.chText: 那出戏让我们笑得前仰后合。
data.enText: The play had us in stitches .
not have a stitch on
not be wearing a stitch
to be naked
a stitch in time (saves nine)

data.chText: 及时缝一针能省九针；小洞及时补，免遭大洞苦
data.enText: it is better to deal with sth immediately because if you wait it may become worse or more difficult and cause extra work
to use a needle and thread to repair, join, or decorate pieces of cloth

data.chText: 她的婚纱是手工缝制的。
data.enText: Her wedding dress was stitched by hand.
An agreement was hastily stitched together (= made very quickly) .
to sew the edges of a wound together
The cut will need to be stitched.
stitch sb↔up
to cheat sb or put them in a position where they seem guilty of sth they have not done
stitch sth↔up
to use a needle and thread to join things together
to arrange or complete sth
to stitch up a deal

data.chText: 他们觉得美国市场已是万无一失。
data.enText: They think they have the US market stitched up.
in stitches
laughing a lot

data.chText: 那出戏让我们笑得前仰后合。
data.enText: The play had us in stitches .
not have a stitch on
not be wearing a stitch
to be naked
a stitch in time (saves nine)

data.chText: 及时缝一针能省九针；小洞及时补，免遭大洞苦
data.enText: it is better to deal with sth immediately because if you wait it may become worse or more difficult and cause extra work
stitch sb↔up
to cheat sb or put them in a position where they seem guilty of sth they have not done
stitch sth↔up

data.chText: 他们觉得美国市场已是万无一失。
data.enText: They think they have the US market stitched up.

tr: a link or loop or knot made by an implement in knitting, crocheting, embroidery, or sewing
a sharp spasm of pain in the side resulting from running

value.def: If you stitch cloth, you use a needle and thread to join two pieces together or to make a decoration.

example.ex: Fold the fabric and stitch the two layers together...
example.tran: 将布料对折，然后将两层缝在一起。

example.ex: ...those patient ladies who stitched the magnificent medieval tapestries.
example.tran: 那些绣出精美的中世纪挂毯的耐心女子

value.def: Stitches are the short pieces of thread that have been sewn in a piece of cloth.

example.ex: You can use embroidery stitches for further decoration.
example.tran: 你可以用刺绣来作进一步的装饰。

value.def: In knitting and crochet, a stitch is a loop made by one turn of wool around a knitting needle or crochet hook.

example.ex: Her mother counted the stitches on her knitting needles...
example.tran: 她母亲数了数编织针上的针数。

value.def: If you sew or knit something in a particular stitch, you sew or knit in a way that produces a particular pattern.

example.ex: The design can be worked in cross stitch.
example.tran: 这个图案可以用十字针法绣出来。

example.ex: ...a woolly vest knitted in garter stitch.
example.tran: 用平针法编织的羊毛背心

value.def: When doctors stitch a wound, they use a special needle and thread to sew the skin together.

example.ex: Jill washed and stitched the wound.
example.tran: 吉尔清洗并缝合了伤口。

example.ex: Dr Armonson stitched up her wrist wounds...
example.tran: 阿蒙森医生将她手腕上的伤口缝好。

example.ex: They've taken him off to hospital to stitch him up.
example.tran: 他们已将他送到医院去缝合伤口了。

value.def: A stitch is a piece of thread that has been used to sew the skin of a wound together.

example.ex: He had six stitches in a head wound.
example.tran: 他头上的伤口缝了 6 针。

value.def: A stitch is a sharp pain in your side, usually caused by running or laughing a lot.
value.tran: (通常指因奔跑或大笑引起的)肋部剧痛，岔气

value.def: If you are in stitches, you cannot stop laughing.

example.ex: Here's a book that will have you in stitches.
example.tran: 这是一本会让你笑破肚皮的书。

trans: 时间之纫；及时处理；及时的一针
最大缝目；针迹长度；线迹宽度；针距；线圈长度
(刺绣的)十字绣，十字形针脚，十字形针法
链状绣；链状针法；链式线迹
平针；平针组织；平针线圈
